column4: hi everyone, i have detected a security exception. relating to the OS logon password in ubuntu 8.10. i actually typed a wrong login password by omitting a special charecter at the end
but still ubunt was able to log me in
the password with the special charecter and without it at the end works
is nt this a security exception, or is this a know bug in ubuntu
How long is your password (including the characters)?
And does the same trick work in console logins?
it works for synaptic also
How long is it?
its about 11 charecters including the final special char
I have a bad feeling it gets trimmed to a certain length....
What is that special char?
it is an exclaimation
or is it that an exclaimation mark at the end is nullified ..
It seems to be. I don't know why, though.
is this a known bug or something. can this be rectified?
I suggest submitting a bug report in https://bugs.launchpad.net/ because I'm interested too. (There seems to be a limit of 10 characters)
for another user on the same machine i have a password that is 12 charecters long!
but it doesnt accept wrong passwords
What if you use a different character instead of !
let me try it out
nope it gives authentication failure. for an @ symbol
i guess this could be a bug
i have filed a bug #4154430 in launch pad
